column1: #This file specifies detector relative efficiencies by giving the coefficients
# to the equation exp( c0 + c1*x^1 + c2*x^2 + ...)

#credit:
These detector response functions have been taken from SNL_GammaQuant_V006_GovUseOnly-ExpCntrl.xlsb produced by Sandia National Laboratories, as well as SimpleMass 6.1 produced by Los Alamos National Laboratory.

#credit:
SimpleMass is a Microsoft Excel based tool that allows determining activity and shielding for peak-based analyses, and is produced by Los Alamos National Laboratory.

#credit:
SNL_GammaQuant.xlsb is an EXCEL spreadsheet application for High Purity Germanium (HPGe) gamma-radiation detector spectrum analysis of unshielded or shielded simple volumetric radioactive sources (right circular cylinders, rectangular volumes, and spheres) utilizing full-energy peak analysis and attenuation correction (shield, self, and volumetric radioactive source attenuation).

#credit:
Contact Michael Enghauser (mwengha@sandia.gov) for additional information.

#credit:
Will Johnson converted the GammaQuant and SimpleMass DRFs to this format, and may have introduced errors - let him know if you have questions or concerns. SAND2022-4320 O
